curam.util.jmx

Class CuramMBeanAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.jmx.CuramMBeanAbstract
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericKeyedPoolStats, GenericNameValueStats, GenericTabularStats

    public abstract class CuramMBeanAbstract
extends java.lang.Object
    Superclass of all Curam MBeans. It is not mandatory for custom MBeans to inherit from this class but making this class their superclass they:
    • get access to fine grained notifications on application configuration changes
    • automatic management of updates to the configuration parameter that enables per user data collection

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      MBean execution context.
      protected static java.lang.String kGenericUserName
      Generic user, used when per user data is not collected.
      protected java.util.regex.Pattern patternUsername
      The regular expression that specifies the users for which statistics are collected individually.

      • isGenericUsername

        protected boolean isGenericUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if username is the generic username.
        Parameters:
        username - the username to check.
        Returns:
        true if username is a generic username.

      • setupUsernamePattern

        protected void setupUsernamePattern()
        Checks the application property for per user statistics and sets up the regular expression pattern.

      • getUsernameKey

        protected java.lang.String getUsernameKey(java.lang.String username)
        Returns the username key to be used for storing per user statistics. If a username pattern is specified, username is checked against the pattern and if it matches this method returns the same value as username, otherwise it returns the generic user name.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user who initiated the Curam operation.
        Returns:
        the username to use for storing individual statistics.

      • getContext

        protected CuramMBeanContext getContext()
        Returns:
        the context of this MBean

        protected java.util.regex.Pattern getPatternUsername()
        Returns:
        the regular expression pattern for user name
